body: FYI, I'll add a new test for this shortly, in this same PR.
Test added. I've verified that it fails without this PR's fix.

If the subchannel is READY and used by a client, will a new client with the same target pick that subchannel? I don't see any reason for no. So I am wondering why we should recycle the subchannel to trigger this issue.

Because by recycling the subchannel, the RR policy is "born READY", so there's no transition triggering a new drainage of pending picks. Basically we need to "warm up" the subchannels somewhere else prior to a new RR policy picking them up, resulting in a RR initial state other than the usual IDLE/CONNECTING

Yeah, I can understand that the subchannel should be born READY to trigger this issue. I don't understand why we should recycle the subchannel though. Isn't the subchannel still READY even without recycling?
Maybe "recycle" isn't the right word. Yes, we use the same subchannel, which stays READY the whole time. Reuse is probably a better description.
Thank you @AspirinSJL for not settling for an unsatisfactory explanation and keep digging. This has resulted in a much simpler test.
